definition: humble abode/to live (in a tiny, cramped space)
snail/Taiwan pr. [gua1]/see 蝸牛|蜗牛[wo1 niu2]
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude

sentences.english: Today I finished watching the whole set of the teleplay named “Living in Small” at noon.
sentences.chinese: 今天中午吃饭时把《蜗居》看完了。

sentences.english: Did you see the shocking lines collected in Dwelling Narrowness by some netizens?
sentences.chinese: 你看过由网友搜集的《蜗居》雷人台词了吗？

sentences.english: Do you have the heart to live in a 10-square-meter room?
sentences.chinese: 你忍心蜗居在不到10平米的小屋里吗？

sentences.english: However, living in the capsule has taken some getting used to for Zhang.
sentences.chinese: 不过，蜗居在这里也有一些令张琪感到不习惯的地方。

sentences.english: After a popular broadcasting of the TV series "Dwelling Narrowness", a rational reflection on it ensues.
sentences.chinese: 电视剧《蜗居》热播过后，理性的思考紧随而来。

sentences.english: And that in Turin there are people who sleep on the pavements, over warm cellar gratings.
sentences.chinese: 在都灵，有人睡在大街上，蜗居在地下室格子间。

sentences.english: Leo: Did you see the shocking lines collected in Dwelling Narrowness by some netizens?
sentences.chinese: 你看过由网友搜集的《蜗居》雷人台词了吗？

sentences.english: Guess what? I spent the whole weekend on the TV show named Dwelling Narrowness.
sentences.chinese: 我整个周末都在看《蜗居》。

definition: migrant worker living and working in Beijing without a residence permit
"ant tribe", college graduates who endure cramped living conditions while trying to develop a career
to work hard/to try to make a living
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
to pass one's days/to scratch out a difficult, meager existence
Fortress Besieged, 1947 novel by Qian Zhongshu 錢鐘書|钱钟书, filmed as a TV serial
